meanings.definition: Capable of being corrected or improved.
meanings.sent1: Her essay showed great rectifiability after receiving feedback from her teacher.
meanings.sent2: The teacher praised the student for her rectifiability in solving math problems.
meanings.sent3: The rectifiability of the broken toy made the child giggle as he tried to fix it.
meanings.sent4: His positive attitude towards rectifiability shone through as he tackled each challenge.
meanings.sent5: The rectifiability of the situation gave them hope for a better outcome.

meanings.definition: The quality of being able to be made right or fixed.
meanings.sent1: The rectifiability of the error was evident once they found the correct solution.
meanings.sent2: Engineers strive for rectifiability in their designs to ensure easy maintenance.
meanings.sent3: The rectifiability of the leaky faucet became a running joke in the household.
meanings.sent4: In relationships, communication is key to achieving rectifiability after misunderstandings.
meanings.sent5: The rectifiability of the painting allowed the artist to make adjustments until it was perfect.
